interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Christmas with the Kranks
Review Date: 2022/03/12
Store: Tim Allen  (Actor),     Jamie Lee Curtis  (Actor),     Joe Roth  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
Product Description: ['When their only daughter Blair leaves the family nest, Luther and Nora Krank (Tim Allen and Jamie Lee Curtis) decide to book an island cruise to beat the yuletide blues and just skip the holidays. But their decision to boycott tradition has the whole neighborhood in an uproar, and when Blair callson Christmas Eve to announce a surprise visit with her new fiancée, the Kranks have just twelve hours to perform a miracle and pull themselves and their neighbors together to throw the best celebration ever! With fast-paced energy and support from Dan Aykroyd, Cheech Marin, Jake Busey and M. EmmetWalsh, this hilarious adaptation of John Grisham\'s best-selling novel, "Skipping Christmas" has become "an instant family classic!" (Gorman Woodfin, CBN)']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama, Family', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Dolby, Dubbed, Closed-captioned, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Dan Aykroyd, 1492 Pictures, Tim Allen, Michael Barnathan, Mark Radcliffe, Jamie Lee Curtis, Chris Columbus, Cheech Marin, Joe RothDan Aykroyd, 1492 Pictures, Tim Allen, Michael Barnathan, Mark Radcliffe, Jamie Lee Curtis, Chris Columbus, Cheech Marin, Joe Roth  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French, Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 39 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1, 2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.56 x 5.25 x 7.55 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2226145', 'Director': 'Joe Roth', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Dolby, Dubbed, Closed-captioned, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 39 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 8, 2005', 'Actors': 'Tim Allen, Jamie Lee Curtis, Dan Aykroyd, Cheech Marin', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Mandarin Chinese, Thai', 'Producers': 'Chris Columbus, Michael Barnathan, Mark Radcliffe', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: An alternative to mushy holiday movies and it still captures the important elements of the holiday- family, friends, faith, helping, giving and rejoicing. It does all this with laughter.
Review Title: Funny family Christmas movie.
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------

profile:
**Updated User Summary:**

The user enjoys a diverse range of content with a strong preference for supernatural genres featuring well-developed characters and stories, including themes involving ghosts, vampires, and werewolves. Their interest also extends to classic horror, quirky dark themes, and emotionally resonant holiday comedies. Their recent purchase indicates a continued enjoyment of family-oriented narratives that balance humor with depth, particularly those involving family dynamics during the holiday season.

The user maintains a trend of positive ratings, showcasing their high expectations for films and series, especially in the superhero and action-comedy genres. Their appreciation for humor that intertwines with serious themes remains evident, particularly in narratives that thoughtfully navigate complex issues.

Additionally, they predominantly favor English-language content but are open to subtitled films in other languages. Their engagement with filmmakers and producers enhances their viewing experience, revealing a deep interest in the creative processes behind the media they consume.

In summary, the user appreciates a blend of humor, emotional depth, and dynamic storytelling, focusing on family relationships and character-driven plots while maintaining a critical yet discerning viewing approach.
